# See https://github.com/check-spelling/check-spelling/wiki/Configuration-Examples:-patterns

(?:AESGCM|ECDHE)[-\w:]+|TLS_[A-Z_\d]+

HTTPbind

"uid": "\w+"

const value = ".+"

match\('.+'

"\^[^"]+"|"[^"]+\$"

\b(?:\w+-){2,}[0-9a-f]{10}-\w{5}\b

# base64 especially pkg/haproxy/socket/socket_test.go (for lack of a block ignore)
^[-a-zA-Z=;:/0-9+]{64}$|^[-a-zA-Z=;:/0-9+]+=$

# openssl output (for lack of a block ignore)
^verify error:.*

# modsecurity output (for lack of a block ignore)
.*\[\w+ (?:"|127).*

# GitHub handles in changelog
\s\(\w+\)$

# Contributors in CHANGELOG
^\* \w+ \w+ \((?=\[)

# Automatically suggested patterns

# hit-count: 1179 file-count: 25
# GitHub SHAs (markdown)
(?:\[`?[0-9a-f]+`?\]\(https:/|)/(?:www\.|)github\.com(?:/[^/\s"]+){2,}(?:/[^/\s")]+)(?:[0-9a-f]+(?:[-0-9a-zA-Z/#.]*|)\b|)

# hit-count: 550 file-count: 26
# version suffix <word>v#
(?:(?<=[A-Z]{2})V|(?<=[a-z]{2}|[A-Z]{2})v)\d+(?:\b|(?=[a-zA-Z_]))

# hit-count: 262 file-count: 40
# https/http/file urls
(?:\b(?:https?|ftp|file)://)[-A-Za-z0-9+&@#/*%?=~_|!:,.;]+[-A-Za-z0-9+&@#/*%=~_|]

# hit-count: 94 file-count: 7
# Contributor
\[[^\]]+\]\(https://github\.com/[^/\s"]+/?\)

# hit-count: 79 file-count: 28
# golang print-f-style functions
(?i)(?<=append|comma|debug|equal|err|error|exit|fatal|info|log|name|panic|print|skip|scan|string|trace|true|warn|warning|wrap|write)(?:f|ln)[ (]

# hit-count: 63 file-count: 2
# Markdown anchor links
\(#\S*?[a-zA-Z]\S*?\)

# hit-count: 25 file-count: 9
# C network byte conversions
(?:\d|\bh)to(?!ken)(?=[a-z])|to(?=[adhiklpun]\()

# hit-count: 22 file-count: 6
# in check-spelling@v0.0.22+, printf markers aren't automatically consumed
# printf markers
(?<!\\)\\[nrt](?=[a-z]{2,})

# hit-count: 21 file-count: 9
# kubernetes pod status lists
# https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/pods/pod-lifecycle/#pod-phase
\w+(?:-\w+)+\s+\d+/\d+\s+(?:Running|Pending|Succeeded|Failed|Unknown)\s+

# hit-count: 20 file-count: 8
# kubernetes object suffix
-[0-9a-f]{10}-\w{5}\s

# hit-count: 14 file-count: 13
# container images
image: [-\w./:@]+

# hit-count: 11 file-count: 4
# hex runs
\b(?=(?:[a-fA-F]{0,2}\d)*[a-fA-F]{3})[0-9a-fA-F]{16,}\b

# hit-count: 9 file-count: 5
# Compiler flags (Unix, Java/Scala)
# Use if you have things like `-Pdocker` and want to treat them as `docker`
(?:^|[\t ,>"'`=(#])-(?:ld?)(?=[A-Z]{2,}|[A-Z][a-z]|[a-z]{2,})

# hit-count: 9 file-count: 3
# uuid:
\b[0-9a-fA-F]{8}-(?:[0-9a-fA-F]{4}-){3}[0-9a-fA-F]{12}\b

# hit-count: 8 file-count: 5
# Library prefix
# e.g., `lib`+`archive`, `lib`+`raw`, `lib`+`unwind`
# (ignores some words that happen to start with `lib`)
(?:\b|_)[Ll]ib(?!era[lt])(?:re(?=office)|era|)(?!ero|erty|rar(?:i(?:an|es)|y))(?=[a-z])

# hit-count: 7 file-count: 5
# Go regular expressions
regexp?\.MustCompile\((?:`[^`]*`|".*"|'.*')\)

# hit-count: 7 file-count: 5
# Non-English
# Even repositories expecting pure English content can unintentionally have Non-English content... People will occasionally mistakenly enter [homoglyphs](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Homoglyph) which are essentially typos, and using this pattern will mean check-spelling will not complain about them.
# .
# If the content to be checked should be written in English and the only Non-English items will be people's names, then you can consider adding this.
# .
# Alternatively, if you're using check-spelling v0.0.25+, and you would like to _check_ the Non-English content for spelling errors, you can. For information on how to do so, see:
# https://docs.check-spelling.dev/Feature:-Configurable-word-characters.html#unicode
[a-zA-Z]*[ÀÁÂÃÄÅÆČÇÈÉÊËÌÍÎÏÐÑÒÓÔÕÖØÙÚÛÜÝßàáâãäåæčçèéêëìíîïðñòóôõöøùúûüýÿĀāŁłŃńŅņŒœŚśŠšŜŝŸŽžź][a-zA-Z]{3}[a-zA-ZÀÁÂÃÄÅÆČÇÈÉÊËÌÍÎÏÐÑÒÓÔÕÖØÙÚÛÜÝßàáâãäåæčçèéêëìíîïðñòóôõöøùúûüýÿĀāŁłŃńŅņŒœŚśŠšŜŝŸŽžź]*|[a-zA-Z]{3,}[ÀÁÂÃÄÅÆČÇÈÉÊËÌÍÎÏÐÑÒÓÔÕÖØÙÚÛÜÝßàáâãäåæčçèéêëìíîïðñòóôõöøùúûüýÿĀāŁłŃńŅņŒœŚśŠšŜŝŸŽžź]|[ÀÁÂÃÄÅÆČÇÈÉÊËÌÍÎÏÐÑÒÓÔÕÖØÙÚÛÜÝßàáâãäåæčçèéêëìíîïðñòóôõöøùúûüýÿĀāŁłŃńŅņŒœŚśŠšŜŝŸŽžź][a-zA-Z]{3,}

# hit-count: 4 file-count: 2
# curl arguments
\b(?:\\n|)curl(?:\.exe|)(?:\s+-[a-zA-Z]{1,2}\b)*(?:\s+-[a-zA-Z]{3,})(?:\s+-[a-zA-Z]+)*

# hit-count: 3 file-count: 1
# go install
go install(?:\s+[a-z]+\.[-@\w/.]+)+

# hit-count: 2 file-count: 1
# hex digits including css/html color classes:
(?:[\\0][xX]|\\u\{?|[uU]\+|#x?|%23|&H)[0-9_a-fA-FgGrR]*?[a-fA-FgGrR]{2,}[0-9_a-fA-FgGrR]*(?:[uUlL]{0,3}|[iu]\d+)\b

# hit-count: 2 file-count: 1
# This does not cover multiline strings, if your repository has them,
# you'll want to remove the `(?=.*?")` suffix.
# The `(?=.*?")` suffix should limit the false positives rate
# printf
%(?:(?:(?:hh?|ll?|[jzt])?[diuoxn]|l?[cs]|L?[fega]|p)(?=[a-z]{2,})|(?:X|L?[FEGA])(?=[a-zA-Z]{2,}))(?!%)(?=[_a-zA-Z]+(?!%)\b)(?=.*?['"])

# hit-count: 1 file-count: 1
# GitHub actions
\buses:\s+(['"]?)[-\w.]+/[-\w./]+@[-\w.]+\g{-1}

# hit-count: 1 file-count: 1
# IPv6
\b(?:[0-9a-fA-F]{0,4}:){3,7}[0-9a-fA-F]{0,4}\b

# hit-count: 1 file-count: 1
# kubernetes applications
\.apps/[-\w]+

# Questionably acceptable forms of `in to`
# Personally, I prefer `log into`, but people object
# https://www.tprteaching.com/log-into-log-in-to-login/
\b(?:(?:[Ll]og(?:g(?=[a-z])|)|[Ss]ign)(?:ed|ing)?) in to\b

# to opt in
\bto opt in\b

# pass(ed|ing) in
\bpass(?:ed|ing) in\b

# acceptable duplicates
# ls directory listings
[-bcdlpsw](?:[-r][-w][-SsTtx]){3}[\.+*]?\s+\d+\s+\S+\s+\S+\s+[.\d]+(?:[KMGT]|)\s+
# mount
\bmount\s+-t\s+(\w+)\s+\g{-1}\b
# C types and repeated CSS values
\s(auto|await|buffalo|center|div|inherit|long|LONG|none|normal|solid|thin|transparent|very)(?:\s\g{-1})+\s
# C enum and struct
\b(?:enum|struct)\s+(\w+)\s+\g{-1}\b
# go templates
\s(\w+)\s+\g{-1}\s+\`(?:graphql|inject|json|yaml):
# doxygen / javadoc / .net
(?:[\\@](?:brief|defgroup|groupname|link|t?param|return|retval)|(?:public|private|\[Parameter(?:\(.+\)|)\])(?:\s+(?:static|override|readonly|required|virtual))*)(?:\s+\{\w+\}|)\s+(\w+)\s+\g{-1}\s

# macOS file path
(?:Contents\W+|(?!iOS)/)MacOS\b

# Python package registry has incorrect spelling for macOS / Mac OS X
"Operating System :: MacOS :: MacOS X"

# "company" in Germany
\bGmbH\b

# IntelliJ
\bIntelliJ\b

# Commit message -- Signed-off-by and friends
^\s*(?:(?:Based-on-patch|Co-authored|Helped|Mentored|Reported|Reviewed|Signed-off)-by|Thanks-to): (?:[^<]*<[^>]*>|[^<]*)\s*$

# Autogenerated revert commit message
^This reverts commit [0-9a-f]{40}\.$

# ignore long runs of a single character:
\b([A-Za-z])\g{-1}{3,}\b
